title: The career woman’s mysterious lack of appeal
author: VD
content_html:
A leading international business consultant offers relationship advice:

What would you say to a woman who wants a career but is afraid to do so because she wants to start a family?

Doctor Monique Siegel: I would tell her to talk to her fiancé and lay down the law. If a woman wants to work outside the family, she has to settle that first at home. What does it mean for us to have a child? Who is going to take care of it? Are you going to give up part of your career because I did not study in order to sit at home and baby-sit my children?

I’m not saying that you’d have to be brain-dead in order to go ahead and marry a woman like this after having such a giant red flag waved in your face, but it sure would help. Of course, this “Dr. Siegel” is obviously a figment of my imagination, since everyone knows that no one could possibly give such overtly stupid advice. It must be a strawfeminist!

The bolder and more confident that feminists become, the more surely they guarantee the extinction of their devolutionary ideology. They don’t want to have children, men don’t want to marry them… it won’t be long before young men wise up enough to avoid dating them altogether. On the plus side, of course, they’ll have no distractions to keep them from shattering the various glass ceilings that trouble them so.
